definitions.definition: To use a plough on soil to prepare for planting.
examples: I've still got to plough that field.
Some days I have to plough from sunrise to sunset.
Trucks ploughed through the water to ferry flood victims to safety.

definitions.definition: To knock over or run over (someone) without stopping.
examples: Three people were ploughed down when he lost control of the truck.

definitions.definition: To furrow ; to make furrows, grooves, or ridges in.
To run through, as in sailing.
To trim , or shave off the edges of, as a book or paper, with a plough.
To cut a groove in, as in a plank , or the edge of a board ; especially, a rectangular groove to receive the end of a shelf or tread, the edge of a panel, a tongue, etc.
To sexually penetrate , typically in a vigorous manner.
examples: I love just getting ploughed face down on my bed.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To use a plough on soil to prepare for planting.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , colloquial ) To knock over or run over (someone) without stopping.
To furrow ; to make furrows, grooves, or ridges in.
( nautical ) To run through, as in sailing.
( bookbinding ) To trim , or shave off the edges of, as a book or paper, with a plough.
( joinery ) To cut a groove in, as in a plank , or the edge of a board ; especially, a rectangular groove to receive the end of a shelf or tread, the edge of a panel, a tongue, etc.
( UK , university slang , transitive ) To fail (a student).
( transitive , vulgar ) To sexually penetrate , typically in a vigorous manner.
